intro: Pentaptelion involucratum, commonly known as the woolly star, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in a dense, spherical cluster. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
